metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8749 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The volume_utils._parse_volume_info function in OpenStack Compute (Nova) before 2015.1.3 (kilo) and 12.0.x before 12.0.1 (liberty) includes the connection_info dictionary in the StorageError message when using the Xen backend, which might allow attackers to obtain sensitive password information by reading log files or other unspecified vectors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8749` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

nova-ajax-console-proxy - 2:12.0.0-0ubuntu2
nova-api - 2:12.0.0-0ubuntu2
nova-api-ec2 - 2:12.0.0-0ubuntu2
nova-api-metadata - 2:12.0.0-0ubuntu2
nova-api-os-compute - 2:12.0.0-0ubuntu2
nova-api-os-volume - 2:12.0.0-0ubuntu2
nova-cells - 2:12.0.0-0ubuntu2
nova-cert - 2:12.0.0-0ubuntu2
nova-common - 2:12.0.0-0ubuntu2
nova-compute - 2:12.0.0-0ubuntu2
nova-compute-kvm - 2:12.0.0-0ubuntu2
nova-compute-libvirt - 2:12.0.0-0ubuntu2
nova-compute-lxc - 2:12.0.0-0ubuntu2
nova-compute-qemu - 2:12.0.0-0ubuntu2
nova-compute-vmware - 2:12.0.0-0ubuntu2
nova-compute-xen - 2:12.0.0-0ubuntu2
nova-conductor - 2:12.0.0-0ubuntu2
nova-console - 2:12.0.0-0ubuntu2
nova-consoleauth - 2:12.0.0-0ubuntu2
nova-network - 2:12.0.0-0ubuntu2
nova-novncproxy - 2:12.0.0-0ubuntu2
nova-objectstore - 2:12.0.0-0ubuntu2
nova-scheduler - 2:12.0.0-0ubuntu2
nova-serialproxy - 2:12.0.0-0ubuntu2
nova-spiceproxy - 2:12.0.0-0ubuntu2
nova-volume - 2:12.0.0-0ubuntu2
nova-xvpvncproxy - 2:12.0.0-0ubuntu2
python-nova - 2:12.0.0-0ubuntu2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: nova package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:12.0.0-0ubuntu2').
